title_en: Socks could really improve your sleep, experts say
title_zh: 專家說，襪子確實可以改善您的睡眠
content_en:
Sign up for CNN’s Sleep, But Better newsletter series.Our seven-part guide has helpful hints to achieve better sleep.
Want to improve your chances for a good night’s sleep? This idea could actually knock your socks on, says behavioral sleep disorders specialist Michelle Drerup.
“It sounds counterintuitive, I know, but by wearing socks to bed and warming your feet, you may actually lower your core body temperature and fall asleep faster,” said Drerup, director of the Sleep Disorders Center at Cleveland Clinic.

想提高您睡個好覺的機會嗎？行為睡眠障礙專家米歇爾·德雷魯普（Michelle Drerup）說，這個想法實際上可能會打破襪子。
克利夫蘭診所睡眠障礙中心主任Drerup說：“我知道，這聽起來違反直覺，但是通過戴襪子床上躺在床上並溫暖腳，您實際上可以降低核心體溫並更快地入睡。”

title_en: Why exercise helps you sleep and why sleep is good for your fitness routine
title_zh: 為什麼運動可以幫助您入睡，以及為什麼睡眠對您的健身習慣有益
content_en:
EDITOR’S NOTE:Before beginning any new exercise program, consult your doctor. Stop immediately if you experience pain.
The health benefits of a good night’s sleep have long been touted by researchers and medical professionals.
While you’re catching z’s, your body ishard at workmaintaining your physical and mental health. It does so by repairing and boosting your cardiovascular and immune systems, plus regulating your metabolism. Your brain also consolidates memories and processes information from the day.

title_en: Cognitive shuffling: A mental trick to help you quiet racing thoughts and fall asleep

content_en:

When Dr. Luc Beaudoin was an undergraduate student nearly 40 years ago, he often hadtrouble falling asleepon Sunday nights and was eager to find a solution.
He found inspiration ina cognitive psychologyclass he was taking anda professor’s theoryregarding visual motion detection, Beaudoin, now a cognitive scientist, said. Visual motion detection refers tothe visual system’s ability to perceive and process motion based on changing patterns of light on the retina.
